properties.Name: Barnardos 16+ Visiting Support Service
properties.Address: Throughcare and Aftercare, 329 High Street, Edinburgh
properties.Description: Barnados 16+ Visiting Support gives housing support for young people between the ages of fifteen and twenty-one who have been looked after. The service will not work with people who fail to engage or with people who have an active drug addiction.
properties.Other details: This is a short term service that can support people for up to two years.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Barnardos Care Leavers
properties.Address: Throughcare and Aftercare, 329 High Street, Edinburgh
properties.Description: Barnados Care Leavers gives accommodation service for young people between the ages of 15 and 21 who have been looked after and who have housing support needs. The service will not work with people who fail to engage or with people who have an active drug addiction.  It can only be accessed by contacting Through Care and After Care.

properties.Name: Barony
properties.Description: Barony HA gives housing support to vulnerable people, including those with enduring mental health problems and offending backgrounds.  People can get one to one support or attend the Contact Point Drop in Centre.
properties.Clients:
Learning disabilities
Physical disabilities 
Mental health
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Bethany Christian Trust
properties.Description: Bethany Christian Trust gives support and accommodation to help stop people being or becoming homelessness. Support includes help for people with addiction issues, drop ins and community education.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Blackwood Care
properties.Description: Our service is tailored to the individual and offers choice and promotes independence. Our aim is to assist people to maintain their own tenancies we work with the person to meet their outcomes.  We provide support with general household tasks, meal preparation and life skills.
properties.Clients: Blackwood provides Community support to customers who have a physical disability, experience mental health issues, older people, care leavers, young people, people with learning disabilities, drug / alcohol abuse issues, refugee / asylum seekers, vulnerable single parents, homeless people and those at risk of homelessness and other vulnerable adults.
properties.Other details: This can be a longer term housing support service.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Blackwood Care - Community Worker
properties.Description: Our Community Support Worker provides out reach support to assist with Housing options and form filling i.e. benefits or other official correspondence. We offer advise on returning to work, Education or Volunteer work in the local community.
properties.Clients: Blackwood provides Community support to customers who have a physical disability, experience mental health issues, older people, care leavers, young people, people with learning disabilities, drug / alcohol abuse issues, refugee / asylum seekers, vulnerable single parents, homeless people and those at risk of homelessness and other vulnerable adults.
properties.Other details: This is usually a short term service.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Care and Repair
properties.Description: Care and Repair help older people and disabled people living in private housing which was in poor repair or below the tolerable standard.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Carr Gomm
properties.Description:
Our support can help you to get the skills so you can do practical tasks such as housework, making a meal, shopping or laundry or getting out and about. 
Carr Gomm also provides other services that can provide personal care such as bathing.
properties.Clients: Older people, people with physical support needs, people with autism, people with mental health problems, people with learning disabilities, people with addictions and people with other support needs
properties.Other details: This can be a longer term housing support service.
properties.What to do next: Once the service user has a Carenap assessment, refer the person to the Edinburgh Mental Health and Wellbeing/ Substance Misuse Accommodation and Support panel mentalhealthaccommodationpanel@edinburgh.gov.uk.

properties.Name: Castlecliff
properties.Description: 24 hour staffed accommodation. Offers a range of support including resettlement. High quality accommodation with en-suite facilities in all bedrooms. Shared communal facilities. There are 9 supported flats including and a satellite flat in the local community.
properties.Clients: Single men, women or couples who are homeless aged 16+. Some provision for pets.
properties.What to do next: Please contact Temporary Accommodation Service on 0131 529 7125  or visit 1a Parliament Square, Edinburgh, EH1 1RF

properties.Name: CHAI (Community Help & Advice Initiative)
properties.Address: 1st floor ELS house, 555 Gorgie Road, Edinburgh
properties.Description:
The CHAI Housing Support Team deliver city-wide housing support through a visiting support service aimed at maintaining tenancies and promoting independence. 
The CHAI Substance Misuse Support Service deliver support to people with substance misuse problems resident in South West Edinburgh.
properties.Clients: Individuals, couples and families aged 16 plus.
properties.Other details: This is a short term service that can support people for up to two years.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Changeworks
properties.Description: Changeworks’ Domestic Advice Team give free, confidential and impartial energy and fuel billing advice to households, helping save money on fuel bills, apply for grants and make homes warm.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: City Youth Cafe
properties.Description: The City Youth Café gives advice and support for young tenants aged between fifteen and twenty-one to help them get emergency and permanent accommodation, provide housing advice and help them manage their tenancy.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: City Youth Cafe - Drop in Service
properties.Description: The City Youth Café has a drop in service at 6 Victoria Terrace for people aged between 13 and 21. We offer emotional and practical housing support for young people and their families within the city of Edinburgh. We offer a food voucher scheme that offers hot food to those classed as homeless and to the most vulnerable young people within the city.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Comely Green Service
properties.Address: Link Group Ltd, Link House, 2C New Mart Road, Edinburgh
properties.Description: This accommodation service is in a mixed development of tenancies and accessed by the Community Rehabilitation Team.  Support is flexible and responsive to individual need.
properties.Clients: Mental Health, Anyone aged 18 and over. Accommodation Service.
properties.What to do next: Once the service user has a Carenap assessment, refer the person to the Edinburgh Mental Health and Wellbeing/ Substance Misuse Accommodation and Support panel mentalhealthaccommodationpanel@edinburgh.gov.uk.

properties.Name: Connected Learning and Employability
properties.Description: A social enterprise providing: person centred employability support and case management; life skills, personal effectiveness and work skills training programmes; full-time work placements; and part-time volunteering opportunities.
properties.Clients: Unemployed and vulnerable young people and adults with multiple and complex needs (3 or more significant barriers to employment).
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Cross Reach Cunningham House
properties.Description: Cunningham House is a short-stay, supported hostel for homeless people located in the heart of Edinburgh.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Cross Reach Rankeillor
properties.Description: Cross Reach Rankeillor is supported accommodation for men in recovery from drug/alcohol misuse in shared flats in central Edinburgh.  They also give support for people in their own homes in Edinburgh to address issues around their substance misuse
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Cross Reach Threshold
properties.Description: Cross Reach Threshhold gives housing support and care at home to adults with a learning difficulty and associated physical health needs.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Cyrenian's Homelessness Prevention Service
properties.Address: Norton Park, 57 Albion Road, Edinburgh, EH7 5QY
properties.Description: Homeless prevention Service helps people who in difficulty with their housing situation. Clients can be social tenants, private tenants or homeowners and can be in a tenancy or in temporary accommodation. The service includes advice, advocacy and practical support, and can help with securing your current home or planned re-settlement to more appropriate housing.
properties.Clients: Anyone who has not been homeless in the last two years
properties.Other details: This is a short term service that will usually support people for up to six months.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Cyrenians Community
properties.Description:
Cyrenians Communities provides residential care to young people at the site in Edinburgh City and the small Farm community in West Lothian
The holistic support gives security, structure and boundaries to young people and helps them achieve goals including a City and Guilds qualification.
properties.Clients: 16-30 yr olds who have experienced or are at risk of homelessness.  Individuals placements are funded by social work.

properties.Name: Dean and Cauvin Trust
properties.Description: Dean and Cauvin Trust supports young people aged between fifteen and twenty-one. They provide supported accommodation and support for young people for up to two years after they have moved out of the Trusts supported accommodation.
properties.Other details: This is a short term service that can support people for up to two years.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Dunedin Harbour Hostel
properties.Description: 24 hour direct access supported accommodation.  Support offered with housing advice, addiction, physical and mental health and resettlement. High quality accommodation with en-suite facilities in all room and shared kitchens. 12 week stay. Disabled access.
properties.Clients: Homeless persons aged 16-60+, male and female. people with pets, couples and friends sharing.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Edinburgh Furniture Initiative
properties.Address: Four Square (Scotland), Four Square Hub, 67a Logie Green Road, Canonmills, Edinburgh
properties.Description: Good quality re-usable furniture and appliances
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Edinburgh Housing Advice Partnership (EHAP)
properties.Address: 1st Floor, ELS House, 555 Gorgie Road, Edinburgh
properties.Description: EHAP give free and confidential housing advice, information, education and court representation to Edinburgh tenants of all tenure types and owner-occupiers to help them keep their homes.
properties.Clients: Council, private and housing association tenants, owner-occupiers and anyone affected by homelessness.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Edinburgh Mental Health Service
properties.Address: Link Group Ltd, Link House, 2C New Mart Road, Edinburgh
properties.Description: This service provides support for people living in their own homes.  Support for individuals is available to sustain their accommodation and develop their life skills.
properties.Other details: This can be a longer term housing support service.
properties.What to do next: Once the service user has a Carenap assessment, refer the person to the Edinburgh Mental Health and Wellbeing/ Substance Misuse Accommodation and Support panel mentalhealthaccommodationpanel@edinburgh.gov.uk.

properties.Name: Edinburgh Women's Aid
properties.Description: Edinburgh Women's Aid  has refuges and visiting support.  A refuge is a temporary safe house that can be an ordinary council house or a purpose built refuge.  Edinburgh Women's Aid has refuges and visiting support. A refuge is a temporary safe house that can be an ordinary council house or a purpose built refuge. Edinburgh Women's Aid workers can provide follow on support to women who lived in a refuge.
properties.Other details: This is a short term service that can support people for up to two years.
properties.What to do next: PPlease contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Edinburgh Young Person's Service
properties.Address: Link Group Ltd, Link House, 2C New Mart Road, Edinburgh
properties.Description: Support is available to help young people find secure housing, and set up and sustain their tenancy.  We have access to a few Scottish Short Secure Tenancies for service users.
properties.Other details: This is a short term service that can support people for up to two years.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Enable Scotland
properties.Description: Enable Scotland provides support to people with learning disabilities to enable them to live independent and integrated lives in the community

properties.Name: ESIST
properties.Description: ESIST works with young people leaving care / have left care at risk of homelessness, 14-25 years.  One to one support, detached youth work in Edinburgh, school workshops
properties.Clients: Young people, 14-25 who are leaving or have left care
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Four Square
properties.Address: Four Square (Scotland), Four Square Hub, 67a Logie Green Road, Canonmills, Edinburgh
properties.Description: Four Square  provides a range of services to help people find, furnish and keep their home including visiting support, hostel accommodation, supported accommodation, Conected, Employability Service, Employability Training Services, ADAPT young parents visiting housing support and Edinburgh Furniture Initiative (EFI).
properties.Other details: Follow up is a short term service that will usually support people for up to six months.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Garvald
properties.Description: Garvald supports adults with learning difficulties to access a range of living options in good quality tenancies.

properties.Name: Gateway to Homes and Communities
properties.Description: Gateway to Homes and Communities provide furniture and furnishings to help people who have been homeless to set up a new home.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Gateway Visiting Support
properties.Description: Gateway Visiting Support gives housing support to help people keep their home including help with handling money, dealing with addictions, managing health problems and other life issues, as well as accessing employment and training.
properties.Other details: This is a short term service that will usually support people for up to six months.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Health in Mind
properties.Description: Health in Mind gives advice, support and information for people experiencing or recovering from mental health problems.
properties.Other details: This can be a longer term housing support service.
properties.What to do next: Once the service user has a Carenap assessment, refer the person to the Edinburgh Mental Health and Wellbeing/ Substance Misuse Accommodation and Support panel mentalhealthaccommodationpanel@edinburgh.gov.uk.

properties.Name: Home Scotland
properties.Address: Unit 3, Q Court, Quality Street, Davidson's Mains, Edinburgh
properties.Description: Home Scotland housing support service to help people live in their home, establish themselves in a new home or to avoid homelessness.
properties.Other details: In general this is a short term service that will usually support people for up to six months.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Jericho House
properties.Description: Jericho House is open 24 hours per day and provides residential accommodation and housing support for 20 vulnerable adults who have an alcohol problem and/or a mental health problem.
properties.What to do next: Once the service user has a Carenap assessment, refer the person to the Edinburgh Mental Health and Wellbeing/ Substance Misuse Accommodation and Support panel mentalhealthaccommodationpanel@edinburgh.gov.uk.

properties.Name: Key Moves
properties.Description: Keymoves provides 24 hour supported, temporary emergency accommodation to vulnerable homeless women who have a range of difficulties.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: LetFirst
properties.Address: Sugar Bond, 2 Anderson Place (just off Bonnington Road), Edinburgh
properties.Description: LetFirst help people to find a house with a good private landlord without the need for a deposit and advance monthly rent payments.
properties.Clients: Anyone at risk of being homeless who do not have a deposit
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Penumbra
properties.Address: Norton Park, 57 Albion Road, Edinburgh, EH7 5QY
properties.Description: Penumbra gives support to young people who self harm and people who experience mental health problems.  They provide supported accommodation, respite care and peer support.
properties.Other details: This can be a longer term housing support service.
properties.What to do next: Once the service user has a Carenap assessment, refer the person to the Edinburgh Mental Health and Wellbeing/ Substance Misuse Accommodation and Support panel mentalhealthaccommodationpanel@edinburgh.gov.uk.

properties.Name: Places for People  Scotland Care & Support
properties.Address: Craigmillar Social Enterprise & Arts Centre (SPACE), 11 Harewood Road, Edinburgh
properties.Description: Places for People Scotland Care & Support provide housing with support services to older and young people, people with physical and learning disabilities and mental health issues.
properties.Clients:
Acquired Brain Injuries
Learning Disabilities
Mental Health
Young People and Care Leavers
Older People
Physical Disabilities
properties.Other details: Places for People Scotland Care & Support is a subsidiary of Castle Rock Edinvar Housing Association and has access to additional housing.
properties.What to do next: Once the service user has a Carenap assessment, refer the person to the Edinburgh Mental Health and Wellbeing/ Substance Misuse Accommodation and Support panel mentalhealthaccommodationpanel@edinburgh.gov.uk.

properties.Name: Prestonfield Neighbourhood Project
properties.Description: Prestonfield Neighbourhood Project gives advice and information for older people in the Community of South and Central Edinburgh. The PNP centre provides a place for older people to meet and be socially active.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Reach Out
properties.Description: Reach Out provides street based outreach to women involved in street based prostitution.  Follow up support also provided.
properties.Clients: Women involved in street based prostitution.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Richmond Fellowship Scotland
properties.Description: The housing support service provides adults with mental health difficulties / learning difficulties & Autism with support in their own homes and local communities. Supporting people to build skills for independent living
properties.Clients: People of all ages and conditions including Learning Disabilities, Mental Health Issues, Forensic and Autism
properties.What to do next: Once the service user has a Carenap assessment, refer the person to the Edinburgh Mental Health and Wellbeing/ Substance Misuse Accommodation and Support panel mentalhealthaccommodationpanel@edinburgh.gov.uk.

properties.Name: Rock Trust
properties.Description: Rock Trust provides supported accommodation and support for homeless and socially excluded young people between sixteen and twenty-five years old.
properties.Other details: Rock Trust - Mainstay is a short term service that can support people for up to two years.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you knows could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Runaways Action Project
properties.Description: The RAP project work with young people at risk of / or who have run away from home.  Street based outreach, school workshops and one to one support.
properties.Clients: Young people at risk or who have run away from home
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you knows could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Saheliya
properties.Description: Saheliya gives support people with mental health issues of Black and Minority Ethnic women in Edinburgh.
properties.Clients: Women from BME backgrounds with mental health issues
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Salvation Army
properties.Description: The Salvation Army provides supported accommodation for people that are homeless.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: SAMH
properties.Description: SAMH provides a range of community based support services to people affected by mental health issues, homelessness and addictions.
properties.Clients: Mental Health Issues, Addictions, Homelessness and people looking for personalised support services
properties.What to do next: Once the service user has a Carenap assessment, refer the person to the Edinburgh Mental Health and Wellbeing/ Substance Misuse Accommodation and Support panel mentalhealthaccommodationpanel@edinburgh.gov.uk.

properties.Name: Scottish Veterans
properties.Description: The Scottish Veterans provides supported accommodation for people have been in the armed forces who are homeless.
properties.Clients: People have been in the armed forces who are homeless.
properties.What to do next: PPlease contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Share Scotland
properties.Description: Share Scotland provides support to adults with complex learning and physical disabilities with intensive support to enable them to lead as independent a life as possible, in their own home and in their local community.
properties.What to do next: Once the service user has a Carenap assessment, refer the person to the Edinburgh Mental Health and Wellbeing/ Substance Misuse Accommodation and Support panel mentalhealthaccommodationpanel@edinburgh.gov.uk.

properties.Name: Streetwork Crisis Service
properties.Description:
The Crisis Service meets the needs of those in housing crisis, sleeping rough or who, because of complex needs are at risk of housing crisis. 
Support for people under 25 years old is through the Rock Trust – Crisis Service.
properties.Clients: People at risk of rough sleeping
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Streetwork - Tenancy Support
properties.Description: Housing Supports provides one to one support to people in their own homes with complex and multiple needs.
properties.Clients: Anyone with complex and multiple needs.
properties.Other details: In general this is a short term service that will usually support people for up to six months.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Streetwork - Women's Project
properties.Description: Our Women’s project provides one to one support, street based outreach and drop in sessions for women who have complex and multiple needs.
properties.Clients: Women with complex and multiple needs
properties.Other details: In general this is a short term service that will usually support people for up to six months.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: Turning Point - Midpoint
properties.Description: Midpoint provides housing support to people with drug misuse issues who are homeless, have a history of homelessness or at risk of becoming homeless due to difficulty managing their tenancy.
properties.Clients: People with addictions with a history of homelessness
properties.Other details: In general this is a short term service that will usually support people for up to six months.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.

properties.Name: YMCA
properties.Address: James Love House, 11 Rutland Street, Edinburgh
properties.Description: YMCA provides supported accommodation for young people aged between 16 and 25.
properties.What to do next: Please contact this service if you or someone you know could benefit from support from this service or if you want more information.
